123.heading: Twiggs.
123.title: "Can't You Be Serious, Twiggs?"
123.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The major has dreamed he was nominated to run for president, and Twiggs thinks he's heavy enough to start a landslide.

124.heading: Twiggs.
124.title: "He'll Check with Twiggs"
124.author: [No author]
124.series: Our Boarding House, May 23, 1969) Branagan & McCormick.
notes: Summary: The boarders are trying to decide how much to bet against Templeton's ability to do tricks, and one of them has another idea.

125.heading: Twiggs.
125.title: "His Curve Ball Worked in the Clutch"
125.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: Twiggs wants to know how Amos explained that his record has been sold as a sleep aid; as a former Oxford debating champion he's been telling people that it's being released in England.

126.heading: Twiggs.
126.title: "Looks Like a Big Day for Everybody"
126.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: Amos is on his way to Low Fidelity Records to sign a contract selling the Hoople Dictation Discs; Twiggs has only been watching an apprentice barber shave a wrestler, so he'll come along.

127.heading: Twiggs.
127.title: "The Major has a Large Nest Egg Twiggs Doesn't Know About"
127.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: Amos chides Twiggs for making him, of a line of Shakespearean actors, accept money for his speeches to be used as a sleep-producing record; Twiggs reminds him that Shakespeare himself wrote for money, the best kind of applause.

128.heading: Twiggs.
128.title: "Message to Americans"
128.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Major Hoople's two-paragraph patriotic essay appears on page one of the newspaper, though Twiggs wants to know how he kept it so short; the reader knows that it was originally 14 pages.
Key words: Editing. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "patriotism"

129.heading: Twiggs.
129.title: "An Orgy of Litterbugging Unless I Serve Nothing but Gourmet Meals"
129.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: Twiggs says the roast might interest a fire extinguisher salesman; Amos is caught between Martha's orders and the boarders' threats.

130.heading: Twiggs.
130.title: "Say! Is This Getting to be a Fowl Act?"
130.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Comedy rehearsal. Pike does a gag about bores and parties, and a duck flies out from under Carp's hat. Twiggs says that's a paralyzer.

131.heading: Twiggs.
131.title: "The Wounded Warrior"
131.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Hoople is hiding from the public because he has been bitten on the nose by a baby in his political campaign, and Twiggs says he been "as hard to find as a Republican button in Alabama."

132.title: "Twiggs Cools Him Off Quick"
132.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: They tried the Major's record at the zoo, and a gorilla fell asleep peeling a banana; it's an automatic snoozer and the offer is $100; Amos thinks the idea is libelous but Twiggs shuts him up.

133.heading: "Twiggs is Assistant Sales Manager" (Our Boarding House, Nov.
133.author: [No author]
